intro: Pleurothallis edwallii var. pallida, commonly known as the pale pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale yellow. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that support its foliage and flowering stems. Its leaves are usually narrow and革质, providing a waxy texture that helps it retain moisture in its humid habitat. This variety is appreciated by orchid enthusiasts for its subtle beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
